item.title: The impact of GDPR will be remembered in 2018
item.description: The General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) heavily influenced how we addressed online privacy in 2018. While it primarily protects residents of the European Union, the GDPR’s global reach impacts any company conducting business with EU residents. This broad scope has shifted GDPR from a regional concern to a worldwide one. Several industry leaders have shared their perspectives on GDPR’s significant effects: Source: Sage. Wherrett. Arlene Wherrett, VP and MD of Sage Asia, observed that GDPR was a major catalyst for change in business operations.

item.title: Sage Hotel in West Perth has been opened by Silverneedle
item.description: Source: Silverneedle. Sage Hotel, West Perth. SilverNeedle, a hotel group based in Singapore, has partnered with Australian Development Capital (ADC), a Perth-based real estate developer, to open a new Sage Hotel in West Perth. This A$35 million project marks the debut of the Sage Hotel brand in Perth, a city gaining popularity among Singaporean business and leisure travelers, and positions the brand within the upscale hotel market. Sage aims to provide a unique experience that reflects the local community and goes beyond standardized global hospitality.

item.title: SilverNeedle Hospitality introduces the new Sage Hotel brand, catering specifically to upscale business travelers
item.description: SilverNeedle Hospitality, headquartered in Singapore, has introduced a new upscale hotel brand, Sage Hotel, tailored for business travelers. The first Sage Hotel will be located in Brisbane, Australia. Iqbal Jumabhoy, Managing Director & Group Chief Executive Officer at SilverNeedle Hospitality, stated, “We recognize a significant group of business travelers seeking a consistent and straightforward experience while working in unfamiliar cities.” He added, “Sage Hotel is designed to meet their needs and complements our existing portfolio of six brands.
